title.rendered: Bangalore vs Gujarat, India Women’s League 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Team

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Bangalore: Smriti Mandhana (c), Sophie Devine, Ellyse Perry, Heather Knight, Kanika Ahuja, Richa Ghosh (wk), Shreyanka Patil, Disha Kasat, Megan Schutt, Asha Shobana, Renuka Thakur Singh

Gujarat: Sophia Dunkley, Laura Wolvaardt, Harleen Deol, Ashleigh Gardner, Dayalan Hemalatha, Sneh Rana (c), Sushma Verma (wk), Kim Garth, Tanuja Kanwar, Mansi Joshi, Ashwani Kumari

Pitch Report

Venue: Brabourne Stadium, Mumbai

(Based on the last three games)

1st innings average score: 156

2nd innings average score: 143

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: Good for batting

Wins

Batting 1st: 67%

Batting 2nd: 33%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

Laura Wolvaardt has been in sublime form lately: she has smashed five fifties in her last six innings.

Although Ellyse Perry is yet to strike with the ball at the Brabourne Stadium, she has made amends by adding 128 runs including the highest score of 52.

Harleen Deol (186 runs at 31) and Sophie Devine (167 runs and two wickets) have featured in the Best11 in their last five games. Both slammed a half-century each when they crossed paths a week ago.

Amidst scores of four and a duck, Sophia Dunkley’s highest score (65) of the season came at the very venue. Incidentally, it was Bangalore who suffered as she went at a belligerent strike rate of 232.

Besides providing bonus points for thirty-plus scores in her last two outings, Richa Ghosh has overall inflicted seven dismissals in the tournament.

After struggling to make an impact with the ball in the initial stages, Tanuja Kanwar has picked three wickets in her last two visits to the Brabourne Stadium.

When these teams locked horns earlier in the league, Ashleigh Gardner (19 runs, three wickets, and a catch) and Heather Knight (30 runs, two wickets, and two catches) were the captain and vice-captain of the Best11 respectively.

After six games, Renuka Thakur Singh has only a wicket to show for her efforts.
